newsPosts.title: Fireworks, Not Fire Alarms
newsPosts.body:
### Tariff Talk, Transparent Pricing, and Our Commitment to You
Elephants are not normally associated with the advent of Spring, but this Spring, there is a ‘tariff-elephant’ in the room that can't be ignored. Here at North of the Border Fireworks, my wife, Gwen, and I want to bring clarity to you, our customers, and put your minds at ease. We have been very proactive, stretching all the way back to December when we brought in two shipments to begin to bolster our inventory at 2024 prices. As we entered into the new year, we continued to take actions that would mitigate the impact of any tariffs on our pricing. We initiated some pre-tariff shipments, we put some down payments on some pre-tariff orders so that the supplier would hold the price at pre-tariff levels, and we have maintained vigilant communication with our suppliers to take advantage of any freight and product reductions available to those who responded promptly. Consequently, the impact will be minimal. By the time July 4th arrives, we will have limited the increase to 10%. When compared to the size of the tariffs being employed against Chinese imports, a 10% increase is simply good stewardship. Our promise to you, our valued customers, is that we will do everything within our power to keep your costs reasonable and fair. We are in this for the long run. We want you to return time and time again with the confidence that we will continue to bring you the best quality, the best service, and the best pricing possible.

We are honored to be your fireworks supplier.
Thom and Gwen Hill, Owners

faq.title: Can Pennsylvania residents purchase fireworks?
faq.answer:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our website. You are probably aware that a new PA fireworks law took effect on October 30, 2017. At the outset, let me say that it has brought welcome, reasonable, and long-awaited change. My intention here is not to give you the many details of the new law. ( For all the details Google PA Fireworks Law, Act 43 of 2017 ) Rather, let me boil the new law down to the most essential points that directly affect you in your purchase of consumer fireworks.
The first point and the cornerstone, of the new law, is that Pennsylvania residents are no longer required to secure a township permit in order to buy aerials or firecrackers. Thankfully, everything is legal for everyone! A second point, and one less publicized, is that consumer fireworks can now be legally discharged in Pennsylvania. There are several regulations governing their discharge with the two most prominent as follows: First, the individual is to be at least 18 years of age. And secondly, any discharge on public or private property must be done with the express permission of the property owner.

faq.title: Can I purchase fireworks by the case?
faq.answer: North of the Border Fireworks did have a Case-Lots program in the past. However, with supply chain issues occurring since the beginning of the pandemic, we have had to put a halt on that program indefinitely. If and when things ever settle back to normal, we may revisit the possibility of selling select items by the case.

faq.title: Do you have M80s, dynamite, cherry bombs, or other non-aerial explosives
faq.answer: Non-aerial explosives any larger than a firecracker have been banned by the Federal Government for some time. There is no way for a consumer to legally buy these kind of explosives.

faq.title: What is the quality of your product?
faq.answer: It is excellent. We have a great relationship with our supplier who meticulously and carefully selects all the fireworks we have in the store. In this way, we only pick up items that have been verified to reliably ignite, perform excellently, and provide the best displays of any other fireworks on the market.

faq.title: Where are the really big ones?
faq.answer: The Federal Government has put a limit on the size of shells and amount of powder in each shell. There is nowhere that you can legally buy shells that are over 3" in diameter or have more than 60 grams of powder inside. Large cakes can have a total of 500 grams of powder in the entire configuration, but the shells are still limited to 3" and 60 grams each.

faq.title: What is the difference between fountains and aerials?
faq.answer: The main difference between ground fireworks and aerial is that ground fireworks perform their display on the ground by emitting sparks, smoke, and noise while aerial fireworks are first launched into the air before they display. Both are safe when used properly, while sober, and with common sense.

faq.title: Is it legal to ignite fireworks in Pennsylvania?
faq.answer: Yes, however, you need the permission of the property owner before you light them off. No matter where you do it, make sure to clean up the cardboard and clay from the area.

faq.title: Can a firework device ignite accidentally?
faq.answer: All modern devices use what is called a "safety fuse." This means that no matter how hot a room in your house or the trunk of your car gets, the fireworks will not ignite. In fact, a flame must actually be in contact with the fuse for a short period of time before it will ignite and activate the display.

faq.title: How long are fireworks good for?
faq.answer: Fireworks, like a fine wine, actually dry out and get better with age, provided that they are kept dry. Storing fireworks in a humid environment such as a hot attic or musty basement can negatively affect the performance of your devices.

pricing.title: High Roller Rollback
pricing.entry:
If you spend (at one time or cumulatively within a 12-month period) at least $750 on fireworks and would like a no-frills solution to saving money, NOTB has created a HighRoller Rollback program to fit your needs. As a HighRoller, every time you come in, our pricing automatically converts from '2 for 1' to '3 for 1' all the time everyday! Did we mention that pricing is FOR LIFE? No frills. All perks.

You don’t have to worry about accruing loyalty program points or getting some extra free fireworks to make the purchase sweet, because straight from the get go, the '3 for 1' pricing far exceeds the benefits of accruing points and receiving free fireworks.

pricing.title: Very Important Pyromaniac (VIP)
pricing.entry:
- North of the Border’s Very Important Pyromaniac loyalty program truly has no downside. You receive a __$5 sign-up bonus__, which is just wild. It’s like we’re just giving free fireworks away on top of the free fireworks you already get with every purchase.
- __For every $100 you spend, you get another $5__ heaped on top of your sign-up bonus. Which, yes we know, is just absurd. It’s almost like we don’t even want you to have to pay for fireworks. Ok, we may be a bit melodramatic about our program, but thousands of customers will tell you that it’s a great deal.
- The icing on the cake is that once you sign up in the store, you don’t have to have your ID scanned every time you come in. Just walk in, show us your VIP card and ID, and presto: you’re in!
